nodes.text: How are things going for you?
I've been counting the days until the break. It will be so good to get away from this place for a while.
So what are you doing during Midterm?
Oh, a little bit of this and that... Keep an eye on things around here and let me know if anything exciting happens while I'm gone, will you, Ginger?
Turns out that the rumors of Katie being a pirate's daughter are true...
So there really is lost pirate treasure in the sea caves below the school... Who would have thought that working at a school could be so entertaining?
There is a rumor that the Gogs who infest the sea caves were once human. They were fisherfolk who worshipped a Dark One and were granted the boon that they would never drown.
It's a object lesson in "Be careful what you wish for... you might get it."

nodes.message: Only if Katie's Map has been stolen

nodes.text: Sosi stole Katie's map and tried to get me kicked out of school...
Well, well, well, the best laid plans go astray... A good lesson for all of us to keep in mind.
I believe the real thief of the map was Caesari's pet weasel, Kyro. His father worked for one of the most notorious of power brokers in Silmaria - Senor Ferrarri.
Kyro is just like his father - an unscrupulous toadie who sold his soul to the highest bidder. Caesari better watch his back for daggers when Kyro turns on him.
The other evening after dinner, Terk called me into his office...
So that scumbag is blackmailing you to betray Gerhard... How peculiar... The question is what does your benefactor have against von Urwald? It sounds personal.
I happened to see Terk go into a tavern a few evenings ago. It seemed so odd that I followed him there. He sat at a table looking uncomfortable as a large, cloaked man walked up to him.

I couldn't overhear what they were talking about, but it was clear that Terk was not pleased with the conversation. He clearly tried to argue with the big man, but then Terk went pale with fear and just nodded his head.
I'd say that Terk is not enjoying his connection to your patron.
I hear that Sosi's family faces financial ruin, so they sent Sosi here to try to find some treasure rumored to be hidden in the sea caves.
Oh, really? That would explain why he came here to the school.
You'd better question your source, Cutie. Caesari spends money too freely for someone who is broke.
The Sosi family of Sicilia is large and powerful. They are related directly to the Royal family. If anything happens to the heir of the Prince, a Sosi will be on the throne.
I just don't know yet what part of the family Caesari comes from, assuming that he is who he says he is.

nodes.message: Only if it's after 21 (and Terk has given Shawn the assignment)

nodes.text: The other evening after dinner, Terk called me into his office...
So that scumbag is blackmailing you to betray Gerhard... How peculiar... The question is what does your benefactor have against von Urwald? It sounds personal.
I happened to see Terk go into a tavern a few evenings ago. It seemed so odd that I followed him there. He sat at a table looking uncomfortable as a large, cloaked man walked up to him.

I couldn't overhear what they were talking about, but it was clear that Terk was not pleased with the conversation. He clearly tried to argue with the big man, but then Terk went pale with fear and just nodded his head.
I'd say that Terk is not enjoying his connection to your patron.

According to Joel Kyro, the other night Sosi snuck out of the castle around midnight to meet with someone in secret. Sosi came back from the meeting visibly shaken and noticeably limping, but refused to talk to Joel about what happened.
So Caesari is sneaking out on his own? Interesting...
The Sosi family of Sicilia is large and powerful. They are related directly to the Royal family. If anything happens to the heir of the Prince, a Sosi will be on the throne.
I wonder what mischief Caesari is getting into... Let me know if you learn anything more about this, Sweetheart.
I'll be most appreciative if you do.
I'll see you later!
You know, honey, just forget about doing me a favor by spying on Thomas. I don't really care anymore. I just thought that you'd be a little more reliable source of information than you are.
Try not to disappoint me again, will you, Sweetie?
Keep me informed with any follow up information to what you've told me, Hon. I'm dying of curiosity to know what comes next.
